Antonio:
So, the reality is, anyone who makes high-risk choices can have impairment problems?

Michelle:
Right, high-risk choices up the risk for impairment problems--and research backs this up. We can’t avoid problems by using a designated driver or compensating with "extra effort." There’s only one way to prevent impairment problems. It’s simple, but it’s not always easy; To prevent impairment problems, we have to prevent impairment.

Antonio:
Thanks, Michelle. Remember how we talked about keeping our eye on the ball? Well, we can prevent impairment and future problems by keeping our eyes on the ball and making low-risk choices.
